summary: FBI interview report of a Bureau of Prisons correctional officer regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 23, 2019. The officer describes responding to the body alarm, escorting EMS, following Epstein to the hospital, and his limited interactions with other staff.

connections.description: Parlatore was present as the attorney for the BOP correctional officer during the FBI interview.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys for the SDNY who participated in the same interview.
Both are special agents from different agencies (OIG and FBI) who participated in the same interview.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. A body alarm sounded around 0638-0640 hours. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at approximately 0736 hours.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: FBI, OIG, and AUSAs interviewed a BOP correctional officer regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death earlier that same day. The interview was conducted in the presence of the officer's attorney.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
NY Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
keyFacts: The interview of a BOP correctional officer took place on the same day as Jeffrey Epstein's death (August 23, 2019).
The officer described the timeline: a body alarm sounded around 6:38-6:40 AM, and Epstein was pronounced dead at the hospital at approximately 7:36 AM.
The officer was assigned to follow the ambulance and remain with Epstein at the hospital until superiors arrived.
The officer stated he had no interactions with a person named NOEL regarding the death and only briefly spoke with a person named THOMAS, who said 'I'm ok.'
The officer's attorney, Timothy Parlatore, was present during the FBI interview.
